reviews.text: I stayed at the Savoy to celebrate a special birthday. It was expensive but well worth it. I enjoyed every minute and was very impressed with the luxury and service. There was a minor but irritating hitch in delivering my luggage, however the mistake and inconvenience was acknowledged and made good. I hope to stay again and wholeheartedly recommend it.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.text: Stayed for five days last week. The Savoy is in a terrific location - an easy walk to the West End Theatres, Covent Garden, shopping etc. The renovation is quite lovely, and the rooms were excellent. We had a view of the river, and I'd recommend getting a river view room/suite - the light and outlook is just lovely, and with windows that actually open - the opportunity for fresh air is nice.
reviews.title: Disappointing end...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are well equipped, spotlessly clean, and beautifully kept each day. We had breakfast included, which is a bonus as it is extraordinarily expensive (I travel globally, and it is actually the highest priced breakfast I've ever seen at 31 pounds).
reviews.title: The Savoy London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are generally excellent (see caveat below). The concierge team is truly exceptional - tickets, transportation, directions, shopping etc all done with grace and efficiency. I dumped some last minute changes on them and they handled it easily and pleasantly. Terrific work. Doormen are also fantastic.
reviews.title: Beyond our wildest dreams

reviews.text: Only downside was on checkout. Bill left under the door had two errors (room rate we had on our WRITTEN confirmation was not what was on the bill) and we were charged VAT for a meal we never had (but not charged for an actual meal. Phoned down asking for changes to be made, and they sent someone up for a copy of our confirmation. Promised a call back. None came, and we needed to check out, so went down to reception. 3 people and 25 minutes later corrections got made. No apology, though clearly their glaring error - and no effort to make change expeditiously. The amount was relatively small (less than 100 pounds), and on more than one occasion one of the staff actually made reference to the small amount - not sure why - isn't a mistake a mistake? Disappointing that what would have been a flawless stay (and we stay at Ritz Carltons, Amans, Four Seasons etc) was tarnished at the end - as honestly that was my final impression. I only chose the Savoy because I am a Fairmont Platinum member (we're Canadian).
reviews.title: Afternoon tea 2012

reviews.text: Just before Easter I was lucky enough to spend one night with my wife and 5 year old daughter at The Savoy. This has got to be one of the grandest hotels in the world and lives up to all expectations that I had before arriving.
reviews.title: A hotel everyone should stay in at least once!!

reviews.text: The staff are fantastic, and I don't think I have ever had such good service, particularly from the Door and Front of house staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.text: The room we had was spacious and luxurious, the bed was one of the most comfortable i have slept in. Usually when I stay in a hotel I never sleep very well on the first night, however I had a fantastic sleep which left we recharged and ready for the day ahead.
reviews.title: Almost there...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a Boodles jewellers inside which is worth a visit, the staff were very helpful and accommodating (special thanks to Tiggy for her time).
reviews.title: A Lovely Stay Despite Some Glitches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have chance to use the restaurants / bars in the hotel - (although we would have gone to the American bar, however they do not have a children’s licence, which I think is a bit odd in this day and age. I would agree to saying no children after 18:00 for example, but why not during the day so all guests can use the facility???) All the public space looks great and on my next stay (one without my 5 year old) I will make better use of the bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Truly a 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attention to detail by the staff at this hotel is fantastic. We stayed here for one night in March and the service throughout the hotel (restaurant,bar,reception,room service) we're all fantastic! The hotel itself looks beautiful and is in the perfect location and is everything you would expect and more from a 5 star hotel. But it is really the level of service from the staff that makes this hotel stand out!
reviews.title: Perfect Stay - Attention to detail is fantastic

reviews.text: Every year in April my Mum and I have a trip to London and leave my Husband and Dad to look after the Children. We have stayed in some lovely hotels, however this year we decided to go to the Savoy.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel - Could not fault one thing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the second we arrived they took our bags from the taxi and we didn't see them again until we got to the room. The service was exceptional from start to finish. We stayed in a superior room and the pillows were the softest I have ever slept on.
reviews.title: Excellent - but don't become a parody

reviews.text: We ordered a bottle of Champagne in the American Bar and as we were going out for an early dinner we asked them if we could have one glass out of the bottle and could they keep it until we got back. To be honest I expected them to do this, but when we got back from our meal we were seated and didn't even have to ask for it. I also described a cocktail I once had abroad and have never been able to find since to the waitress, I couldn't believe it when it was exactly the same as I described and I didn't even know the full ingredients. It is this attention to detail that makes the Savoy so special.
reviews.title: A night to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to at the last minute to go watch Legally Blonde at the Savoy Theatre the concierge got us top price tickets for £50.
reviews.title: Weekend Bliss
Superb, Top notch
reviews.text: This is truly a 7 star experience, right from check in to when you leave. The room service menu could use a shake up. But other than that it's an absolutely fantastic experience.
If you are seeking for a luxury hotel in London with a great history, this could be your choice.
reviews.title: London most luxurious hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms, lobby, restaurant, bar, pool : everything you will find in this hotel is worth a 5 stars rating.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are several 5 stars hotel in London with a great service, but none of them in the caliber of the Savoy. This hotel is perfect in every details.
reviews.title: Central, luxurious, classic hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a great trip to The Savoy, its a beautiful place, with great staff! Worth every penny!! Cant wait to go back.
reviews.title: Too formal for me, still nice though...
